page.title: 07TRANSPORT, THEBERTON
page.content: A bus goes through Theberton thrice a week and this gives patrons 3 hours in which to shop or make visits before returning. The route is a B road which crosses the north east corner of teh block and it is also served by another dual carriage road and a single track road but in the main private cars are used plus a few bicycles for getting to work and shopping. The nearest railway station is 3-5 miles away at Saxmundham. Crossing part of the area is the track for the London to Lowestoft railway. In order to use public transport, rail or bus, to the nearby town of Ipswich or London it is necessary to take bus or train from Saxmundham. Private cars are used for most journeys.
